file_content.text: M5-RT = ident scan // You = Imperial VIP!
Isotope-5 mining status: on hold // Approval = pending
M5-RT = welcome returning heroes // Holocall = incoming
M5-RT = welcome returning hero // Holo = incoming
Ah, welcome back, my lord. Why don't I start with the good news?
Ah, welcome back, hunter. Why don't I start with the good news?
Ah, welcome back, Commander. Why don't I start with the good news?
Ah, welcome back. Why don't I start with the good news?
Excellent work, keeping those mercs in line and throwing the Republic off our scent. We were even able to use your distractions to actually mine some isotope-5.
This should hardly come as a surprise. I always succeed.
Naturally.
No need to sweeten the truth on my account. Tell me the rest.
And the bad news?
I did what you asked, and now you have what you want. Mission accomplished, I'd say.
Then my work here is done.
Well... thing is, it's hardly a sizable amount of isotope-5. And, while the Republic was expertly misled, these mercenaries remain a problem.
In short, we must continue to punish the mercs if we're to see them--and, ultimately, the Republic--fully abandon the planet.
I do hope you'll provide continued assistance on Makeb--as your valuable time warrants. Perhaps in time we'll be able to finally strip this planet bare.
You = hero of Makeb // M5-RT = establishing progress params
M5-RT = monitoring Makeb // Hostile presence = affirmative
M5-RT = ident scan // You = Imperial VIPs!
You = cleared // Under-Moff Bensen = standing by // M5-RT = init holo message
Greetings. I've heard many great things about every one of you. I'm in awe.
Greetings, mighty Wrath. If I may say, I never much cared for Darth Baras. Good on you.
Greetings, Dark Lord. I actually watched you defeat Darth Thanaton in the Kaggath. Brilliant.
Greetings, hunter. I hear you tussled with the pirate Reneget Vause. What treasures he must have had!
Greetings, Commander. Your reputation precedes you. But don't worry--I'm not privy to anything sensitive!
Greetings. I've heard so much about you. Very much eager to work together.
You've done excellent work on Makeb. If I may be so bold, I implore you not to abandon the planet just yet.
Under-Moff Bensen. I've been handpicked by Darth Marr himself to oversee isotope-5 mining operations on Makeb. I'm afraid we've hit a bit of a snag.
I hope you have plans in place to rectify this "snag."
That's not good.
I do, indeed. If you'll permit me to explain....
This is the first I've ever heard of an Under-Moff.
"Under-Moff?"
It's a new designation created for me in my unique capacity as the Empire's top military engineer and geologist. But as I said--a snag.
The planet's stable because of me. My work is done.
I couldn't possibly care less.
Yes, of course. But if I could trouble you for just a little more help....
When the Republic and Hutt Cartel fled Makeb together, the Hutts left their mercenary forces to die along with the planet.
Now that we've stabilized Makeb, these mercs have decided to remain and enslave the planet's refugees. That caught the Republic's eye. Now they're nosing about, which means we cannot mine.
All the effort put into this planet would become meaningless if the Republic caught wind of what's happened.
This mess cannot stand.
If they know the planet's stable, it's only a matter of time before they know why.
What does the Republic know?
Yes, that's exactly the problem.
When word of this fiasco reaches Darth Marr, that will be the end of your short career as Under-Moff.
You're in deep trouble.
Oh, Darth Marr is well aware of the situation. And, yes, he is most unpleased.
We need the Republic--and these mercenaries--to lose interest in Makeb by any means necessary.
You'll find further instructions upon your return to the planet; I promise to remain in constant contact. Under-Moff Bensen out.
M5-RT = providing coordinates // M5-RT = efficient droid!
You = legendary // You + Makeb = Imperial victory
